### Seattle Postpartum Health Study

<img align="right" width="350" hspace = "20" src=clipart_FB.jpg>

<font size="4"> As co-principal investigator of the Seattle Postpartum Health Study, I was directly responsible for every aspect of the project, including the following: <br /> <font size="3">

1. Study design <br />
2. Grant writing (funded by [NSF](https://www.nsf.gov/pubs/2005/nsf05607/nsf05607.htm){target="_blank"} and [Wenner-Gren Foundation](http://www.wennergren.org/programs/dissertation-fieldwork-grants){target="_blank"}) <br />
3. IRB approval <br />
4. Informed consent <br />
5. Data management plan <br />
6. Participant recruitment <br />
7. Data collection (including biospecimens) <br />
8. Research personnel management <br />
9. Wet lab work <br />
10. Data analysis and manuscript preparation ([in prep](Statistics.html){target="_blank"}) <br />

### Tsimane Health and Life History Project

<img align="right" width="200" hspace = "20" src=Picture2.jpg>

<font size="4"> As a graduate researcher for the Tsimane Health and Life History Project, I utilized pre-existing data to conduct a series of computational studies looking at how ecological conditions (e.g., parasite burden) drive population-level differences in immune function across reproductive states (e.g., pregnancy). This involved: <br /> <font size="3">

1. Study design <br />
2. Grant writing (funding by the [NSF](https://www.nsfgrfp.org/){target="_blank"}) <br />
3. Extensive data wrangling / cleaning <br />
4. Data analysis <br />
5. Manuscript preparation (see [Publications](Publications.html){target="_blank"}, [Statistics](Statistics.html){target="_blank"}) <br />

### Incline Study

<img align="right" width="200" hspace = "20" src=Incline.jpg>

<font size="4"> As a Post Baccalaureate Research Fellow, I worked with [Dr Cara Wall-Scheffler](https://wallscheffler.wordpress.com/){target="_blank"} to collect energetic and thermoregulation data for  a study investigating the sex-specific effects of terrain on optimal walking speed and cost of transport (results published [here](https://academic.oup.com/icb/article/55/6/1155/2363610){target="_blank"}). My responsibilities included: <br /> <font size="3">

1. Participant recruitment <br />
2. Data collection <br />
3. Dissemination of results

### Women's Health Initiative Clinical Study

<img align="right" width="200" hspace = "20" src=WHI.jpg>

<font size="4"> As a data technician for the Women's Health Initiative at [Fred Hutchinson Cancer Research Institute](https://www.fredhutch.org/en.html){target="_blank"}, I was responsible for:<br /> <font size="3">

1. Participant retention/follow-up
2. Coordination of research personnel conference calls
3. Data cleaning/QC

### Humor and Gender Study

<img align="right" width="200" hspace = "20" src=humor.png>

<font size="4"> As an undergraduate researcher, this was my first experience conducting research. Under the mentorship of [Dr Cara Wall-Scheffler](https://wallscheffler.wordpress.com/){target="_blank"}, I designed and executed a study investigating how comedian gender impacts audience response to jokes. My responsibilities included:<br /> <font size="3">

1. Study design
2. IRB approval (study included deception, thus requiring a full in-person committee review)
3. Participant recruitment (final n=89)
4. Data collection
5. Data analysis
6. Dissemination of results
